ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: Reading fiction for techniques I can pull out and use for myself.
I learned to write fiction! I also learned how to read fiction for craft and about story structure.
I learned the basics of writing fiction.
I learned the various elements of fictional craft and how to structure a story.
plot development

I learned about a lot of the basic building blocks of fiction writing. We read Professor Sexton's book about different elements of craft (characterization, style and tone, plot, etc), and at the same time read a lot of short stories that utilized these elements. Throughout the course, we worked on utilizing the techniques we had learned in very short stories, and in the second half of the semester, we wrote and workshopped a longer short story.
It was very insightful building the fundamental concepts of novel writing

I learned to break the story down into the pieces that make it work and try writing my own!  I had the chance to read and revisit so many memorable works of fiction that I certainly hope to read again.

By taking this course, I learned about various techniques that authors use to develop their narratives. I saw how authors changed their style, voice, perspective, dialogue, and other aspects to create an exciting story.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: Professor Sexton is so jolly and kind. I wish more professors were like him. The readings were also very diverseand I loved that.

I think the workshops were a big strength of the class because it made us bond as a class and helped me a lot with my own writing. I think the only weakness is that I didnt enjoy the books so much, but I loved the short stories, so maybe more short stories would be great.
I thought that this course had a great syllabus, and the feedback process was well-suited for student learning. I enjoyed getting to know my class.
The selection of readings was phenomenal and the class was incredibly well-taught.
amazing short stories for homework, great peer editing workshops

I really enjoyed this course. I absolutely love reading short stories because they pack in so much in a small space, and I think writing is really fun too so for me this class was a really great mix of the two. I would say this class is a bit geared towards newer writers/readers, so sometimes I felt a bit frustrated and wished we had interrogated and examined the material we were working with more deeply, but at the same time it was a very judgement-free zone which is always welcome when you're writing fiction.
I loved the material that we read and the writing assignments. The workshop complement was also so much fun.

I really enjoyed the discussions!  Every class we shared so many ideas that changed the way I approached works like Beloved and As I Lay Dying.  It was great to share our thoughts about books and discuss what made them so great.  The writing exercises were engaging and helpful, as were the peer workshops.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes, and take it with Professor Sexton!

Yes! Its a great way to get exposure to fiction writing without having to apply. I loved that it wasnt selective because it led to an interesting and nice group of students and we had a very friendly class community.
Yes.
Yes!  You really grow as a writer.
yes
Yes, especially if you'd like to work on your fiction writing in a relaxed setting! Professor Sexton does a great job of making sure people feel comfortable sharing their ideas and writing.
Yes I definitely would I loved the class dynamic!

Yes!  Anyone interested in creative writing should take this course.  Professor Sexton does such a great job of walking you through the basic framework and features of a story.  He shares his knowledge and experience in a way that makes putting pen to paper--a task which has often felt so daunting for me--much more manageable.  You spend half the course studying great stories and the other half writing your own (workshopping your work with peers).  He can be a tough grader, but I felt like I grew a lot through this class!

I would highly recommend this course to another student! ENGL 404 provided me with a wide range of short stories and authors and provided a strong foundation for my own short story brainstorming. I also loved the atmosphere of the class because my peers were extremely helpful during the workshop, and they were all very supportive.
